sub_title: IT Manager Shell Ventures & Bootcamp and Spinning Trainer
summary:
1) High-energy and focused to deliver with speed, simplicity and unlocking maximum value to the customer in a high velocity IT environment.
2) Energy business, IT service management and leadership experience working in different roles and organizations. 
3) Experience with mainstream technologies like Cloud Native, containerization, microservices architecture, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Terraform, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) abstracted infrastructure, Docker, Github, observability tools, SaaS. 
4) Global scale: Managing IT strategy & application service development and delivery at enterprise level incl DevOps teams, Site Reliability Engineering, automated testing, build automation, automated deployment and CI/CD pipelines.
5) Leads by example, motivates, inspires and coaches team members effectively.
6) Passionate and dedicated, deliver results with excellence. Operates with a champion customer delivery mindset.
7) Strong experience from IT Service Delivery role managing a delivery and project team in different geographic locations (locally and virtually).  
8) Highly experienced to work across multidisciplinary teams and matrix organizations for the effective and efficient integration of IT services for all applications, infrastructure and data management solutions.
9) Recognized for ability to integrate internal and external organizations and strengthen the relationship by enabling fast access to the right people in a collaborative mode.
10) Resilient under pressure. Demonstrated ability to maintain composure, to be adaptable in difficult situations. 

Skills: People Management, Operational Service Management & Delivery, IT Service Strategy, Agile Project Delivery, AWS Architecting & Design, AWS Cloud Security, Microservices, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Kubernetes, Serverless, Terraform, Jenkins, CI/CD, Docker, Github, Azure DevOps, Product Management, User Centricity, Joint Venture Relationships, Procurement, Stakeholder and Customer Liaison, Contract Management, Budget Management, Azure Cloud, Spatial Data Infrastructure and Design, ITIL v4, Capacity Planning & Management, Release & Change Management, Oracle/SQL, PDF Project Management, Supplier Management.

Coach for novice to expert level bootcamp & spinning classes.

profile_positions.description:
If your company is in renewable energy, new fuels for transport, connected mobility and freight, or digital, we want to partner up. Shell Ventures works with startups and companies from their early stages to their scale and growth phases. We make minority investments that help to develop new technologies and disruptive business models that work to accelerate the energy and mobility transformation thereby leveraging the power of open innovation to accelerate Shell’s transformation.
Our investment focus is a mix of power, mobility, emission management, resources and digital
profile_positions.title: IT Manager Shell Ventures

profile_positions.description: Accountability for IT Operations with products and services (quality & cost) for B2B, B2C, E-Mobility, Hydrogen, Power Generation (Wind, Solar), Nature Based Solutions and Cross-Business platforms. Manage and on-board a rapidly developing hybrid application portfolio mix of Cloud Native, PaaS and On-premise applications.
profile_positions.title: Manager IT Operations Manager Renewables & Energy Solutions

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for Shell’s Business Critical IT application and infrastructure systems with stable, secure and reliable operations across the globe. The team is spread across 3 geographical locations to fulfil the guardian role (24*7). The scope includes both ERP and non-ERP systems that support processes for Finance, Production Sharing, Joint Venture Accounting, Plant Maintenance, Work Management, Integrated Activity Planning, Materials Management, Offshore Logistics and eProcurement. Scope includes SOX applications and critical systems for hydrocarbon production information (real-time) and the allocation of production and reserves management for the group.

Ensure Business Critical IT Landscape operational stability through integration of infrastructure and application components, including appropriate capacity management, disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

1) The team provides the End-to-End Key Performance Indicators for the service delivery of Business-Critical Landscapes.
2) Ensuring Service Level compliance, recovery of major incidents and structural improvements.
3) Effective Situation Management as well as fast service restoration.
4) Escalation point for urgent operational issues. We can be contacted directly (or be contacted by) any of the service providers, either Shell or external.
5) Conduct Landscape reviews, assessments and pro-actively manage risks.

“We hold the line for secure and reliable IT Services and Operations”
profile_positions.title: Manager critical IT Services for Upstream, Integrated Gas & New Energies at Shell

profile_positions.title: Manager Business Critical IT for Upstream, Integrated Gas, Projects & Technology

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for the efficient integration and business delivery of services for applications, infrastructure and data management in the Technical and Competitive IT scope according to agreed quality and cost parameters. Scope includes Smart Solutions, Real Time and Process Automation & Control Optimization to all Businesses in Shell.

Key applications include PI Real Time for Production Well Data and Real Time services at Shell's Refineries and Manufacturing sites across the globe. Well Engineering, Design and Well control tools like Artificial Gas Lift. Production Surveillance and Optimization for example Well Test software and tools to estimate flow rates, determine valve location, pumps, measure temperature and pressure (field instrumentation). Application and infrastructure services for Rotation Equipment, ESP wells and design of nodding donkey/ beampump wells.

Core activities: Landscape Management to ensure products and services are delivered and professionally managed with scope, quality and cost parameters according to service levels and budgets agreed with the Shell Businesses. Ongoing improvement of landscape services.

1. Define, agree and operate effective Service Level Agreements for all landscapes in scope.
2. Sustain an effective cost model structure aligned with platform deliveries and with the correct set of costs, tariffs & business demand to recover all operational IT costs. 
3. Release Management & Deployment
4. Transition from Project to Operational Service Delivery (project to operate).
profile_positions.title: Service Manager Smart & Process Control

profile_positions.description:
o	Operations: Accountable for all own operated service delivery as well as all managed (internal & external) component services that support the agreed portfolio. Ensure services are compliant with security standards and risk controls.
o	Stakeholder Management: Demonstrable engagement with business stakeholders and external vendors, work across multidisciplinary teams and matrix organizations for the effective and efficient integration of IT services. Shell representative for Enterprise GIS IT Service Delivery in the Shell Technical Advisory Panel and externally.
o	People: Managed a delivery and project team (~ 10-15 FTE) in different geographic locations (locally and virtually). Ensure the team is adequately, competently and sustainably resourced to meet business objectives
o	Continuous Improvement: Drive service quality improvements and deliver on SLA’s, implement global application and infrastructure monitoring capability.
o	Release Management & Deployment: Deploy major and minor releases globally with minimal business disruption and mature Landscape Integrated Testing facility to drive landscape release quality improvements.
profile_positions.title: Component Landscape Manager GIS

profile_positions.description:
o Champion Customer Delivery: Deliver solutions to complex Enterprise GIS IT implementations, provide maximum availability and robust service delivery to the businesses. 
o Monitor the application and infrastructure services vigorously to ensure SLA’s are met. 
o Responsible for Enterprise System Design and Capacity Planning to ensure application and infrastructure services are adequately resourced.
o Identify opportunities for Continuous Improvement that are reflected in the operational processes of the landscape.
profile_positions.title: Technical Landscape Services - Geomatics

profile_positions.description:
o Champion Customer Delivery: Deliver on-site solutions to complex Enterprise GIS IT implementations, provide maximum availability and robust service delivery to the customer. 
o External engagements: Responsible for detailed design and capacity planning for external customers, optimize resources.
o Release Management & Deployment: Migration planning and on-site execution for large scale migrations (Agip KCO in London, Schiphol Airport, Nuon, Delta)
o ESRI Authorized Instructor: Provide courses to external customers in the countries supported by the International distributor ESRI Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description: Support on the GIS (ESRI) platform within the company: Technical support for Oracle 9i and 10g views/materialized views on the relational data model of Tele Atlas. Responsible for quality checks on the Rule Database of Tele Atlas. Providing ArcGIS 9 training in different expertise levels to Tele Atlas staff.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: Voluntary Sports Trainer & Coach for novice to expert level of group lessons (bootcamp, trailrun, crossfit, boxing, running).
